business.headline: Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Despite war and warnings, US traded more with Russia than ally UkraineUS President Donald Trump alleges that India has been financing the Russian invasion of Ukraine by importing oil. However, data by the US Census Bureau presents a different picture.

How India plans to tackle Trump's tariff threatIndia has already held five rounds of trade talks with the US, but no deal has been reached. The talks failed mainly because of disagreements over opening India's farm and dairy sectors, and the issue of buying oil from Russia.

Indian refiners hit pause on Russian oil imports after 50% tariff blow: ReportRefiners like Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation have decided not to buy Russian oil on the spot market in the upcoming buying cycle.
Sensex, Nifty end in green as D-Street investors ignore Trump's 50% tariffsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 79.27 points to end at 80,623.26, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 21.95 points to close at 24,596.15.

Why STP and SWP matter more than SIP, explains stock market expertSIPs help you enter the world of investing. But STPs and SWPs help you navigate it wisely, especially when you have a big lump sum to invest or need steady income without eating into your entire savings.

From ally to 'dead economy': Timeline of Trump's tariff turn on IndiaTrump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, bringing the total to 50% on August 6, putting India among the most heavily tariffed nations.

Nayara Energy seeks ships from India to ferry refined fuels: ReportSanctions-hit Nayara is struggling to get vessels for the supply of refined fuels for its retail stations in India. The private refiner has already cut crude runs at its refinery.

Adani to build India's biggest privately funded coal power plant in a decadeThe first of three units at the plant will be commissioned within four years, with the last expected to come online in five years' time, Adani Power said.

TCS hikes salaries for 80% staff amid layoffs: ReportIn a message sent to employees, the company confirmed that the salary increase will apply to around 80% of the workforce and will take effect from September 1, 2025.

How Trump's 100% chip tariff plan has shaken the global semiconductor industrySpeaking from the Oval Office, Trump said the move is aimed at boosting local manufacturing and reducing reliance on foreign-made chips. He added that companies like Apple, which recently committed an extra $100 billion investment in the US, would not be charged the new tariffs.

Trump hits India with 50% tariffs: What's at stake and what next?A sweeping 50% tariff could significantly impact India's export economy, threatening jobs and trade ties. As Donald Trump ramps up pressure, all eyes are now on New Delhi's next move.

entertainment.headline: Top 6 films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendSeveral shows, including actor Jenna Ortega's 'Wednesday' Season 2, premiered on Netflix this week. The new episodes of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show Season 3' and 'Perfect Match Season 3' will also be released on the OTT platform.

Rashmika Mandanna opens up on online negativity: Let people breatheRashmika Mandanna opened up about dealing with trolls, negative PR, and how her genuine kindness is often seen as fake. Despite the criticism, she continues to choose kindness and focuses on her work across multiple film industries.

Isha Koppikar recalls being humiliated by south choreographer: Took it as challengeIsha Koppikar shared that she was publicly humiliated by a choreographer early in her career for not knowing how to dance, which left her in tears. Motivated by the incident, she trained hard and later rose to fame with hit songs like 'Khallas', becoming a celebrated dancer in Bollywood.

Shruti Haasan says Coolie with Rajinikanth is her full-circle moment: ExclusiveActor Shruti Haasan calls working on Coolie a "full-circle moment," highlighting the emotional weight of her character and the thrill of sharing screen space with Rajinikanth in one of the biggest movies of the year.

Censor board under fire for denying certificate to Ajey, decision due in a weekThe Bombay High Court has directed the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) to clearly specify the objectionable scenes in the film 'Ajey'. The court criticised the censor board for creating unnecessary hurdles and asked for a transparent certification process.

Summer I Turned Pretty: What Belly's body language says about Conrad vs JeremiahA deep dive into Belly's voice, body language, and subtle behaviour in 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' reveals more about her true feelings for Conrad and the emotional security he provides, without needing to say a word.

Ranbir is the pillar of our family now, always dependable: Riddhima KapoorIn an exclusive chat with India Today.in Riddhima Kapoor Sahni said, "No matter where he is, my Rakhi always finds him." From shared secrets to long-distance rakhis, Ranbir Kapoor and Riddhima prove that some sibling bonds are always box-office hits!
Project Tiger review: A roaring tale of power, loss and redemption'Project Tiger' highlights India's fight to save its fiercest predator and the challenges behind this landmark conservation effort.

Top films and shows to watch on JioHotstar this weekendJioHotstar's weekend lineup (August 4–7) has something for everyone, from horror and true crime to fun reality shows and action-packed films. Must-watch titles include 'Vina: Before 7 Days', 'India's Biggest Foodie', and 'Mickey 17'.

BB 19 promo: Salman Khan unveils new theme, says this season will be democrazy'Bigg Boss 19' makers released the new promo of the upcoming season that gives a glimpse of what fans can expect from the show. The Salman Khan-hosted season will premiere on August 24.

Confidence Queen's Park Min-young on visiting India and Bollywood: Wait for itThe lead trio of 'Confidence Queen', Park Min-young, Park Hee-soon and Joo Jong-hyuk, spoke to India Today on building chemistry, and Bollywood. Min-young mentions she will hold a fan-meet in India.

Malayalam director Jeo Baby questions National Film Award for The Kerala StoryThe National Film Awards have been widely criticised for biased selections and propaganda films. This has sparked debate over the awards' credibility and merit in the industry.

Chhoriyan Chali Gaon: Sumukhi Suresh, Dolly Javed chase roosters in funny episodeThe latest episode of 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon' saw contestants engaging in a rooster-catching competition. The highlight of the episode was the match between comedian Sumukhi Suresh and influencer Dolly Javed.

Rani Mukerji's award win was always destined, says director Ashima ChibberRani Mukerji won the Best Actress at the 71st National Awards for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'. The film's director, Ashima Chibber, reveals her confidence in Rani's performance and the film's international acclaim.

Radhika Apte recalls lack of empathy in Bollywood during early pregnancy daysActor Radhika Apte recalled early pregnancy days when she was asked to wear tight clothes by a producer despite her discomfort. She also opened up about her emotional and physical challenges in the entertainment industry.

Wanted roles that pushed me: Jr NTR on how fatherhood changed his approach in lifeTelugu superstar Jr NTR shared heartfelt insights on his journey through fatherhood and legacy. He emphasised giving his children freedom to choose their paths while preparing for new cinematic challenges ahead.

James Cameron warns against AI dangers, predicts Terminator-style apocalypseDirector James Cameron has warned that AI integrated with weapons systems could trigger a Terminator-style apocalypse. He highlighted the urgent risks posed by AI, nuclear arms, and climate change converging simultaneously.

Wednesday Season Two Part One review: Colder, creepier, irresistibleRelease Date:Wed Aug 13, 2025Wednesday Season Two Part One review: She may have lost her visions, but not her bite. Part One of 'Wednesday' Season Two trades jump scares for emotional depth, family secrets, and a slow-burning mystery that promises chaos ahead.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot tops ratings chart, beats AnupamaaKyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot has returned strongly on Star Plus, leading the TV ratings. The show surpassed Anupamaa, which slipped to the second spot.

general news.headline: Duplicate voters, fake addresses: Rahul Gandhi claims fraud in Karnataka rollsRahul Gandhi alleged that fake people were being added to voter lists by the ECI in collusion with the BJP and attempted to validate his point by showing the Karnataka electoral rolls.

PM Modi's stern message to Trump: We will pay any price to protect our farmersPrime Minister Narendra Modi's remarks were seen as a direct response to US President Donald Trump, who slapped a 50 per cent tariff on India for its continued purchases of Russian oil. Read the full story below and join the conversation: Should India hold its ground as the US ratchets up its tariff war?

NDA likely to announce Veep pick on August 12; PM, JP Nadda to decide nomineeThe meeting comes just days after Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post due to health reasons, vacating the position on the first day of the Monsoon Session.

Putin to visit India later this year, dates being finalised: Ajit Doval in MoscowIn talks with Russian Security Council Secretary Sergei Shoigu, National Security Adviser Ajit Doval confirmed that the visit is on track and said New Delhi is "excited and delighted" about the upcoming engagement.
The turn that wasn't: How a tampered riverbed turned flood into catastropheThe scale of destruction seen in Dharali village was amplified due to human intervention in the river's natural course.

High Court pauses Punjab's land-pooling policy in big jolt to AAPThe Punjab and Haryana High Court put an interim stay on the operation of the Punjab government's Land Pooling Policy 2025 in response to a petition that challenged the legality and constitutionality of the policy.

Rajasthan horror: Man chases, shoots dead 25 dogs in 2 days; video sparks outrageTwo men on motorcycle were seen chasing stray dogs through a village in Rajasthan while one of them shot them dead. A video of the incident has gone viral, sparking massive outrage.

Delhi Assembly's mysterious chamber really a phansi ghar?The previous Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi claimed that two underground chambers and a tunnel beneath the Assembly building were British-era gallows, possibly connected to the Red Fort. The BJP junked AAP's claims that the chamber was a 'phansi ghar' and called out its spend of Rs 1 crore to turn it into an exhibit. This is what historians and archaeologists have to say about the mysterious chamber.

Trumping the India-US strategic partnershipPresident Trump's tariff regime threatens the edifice of the India-US strategic partnership, but the relationship with Pakistan is causing the most consternation.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.
Dharavi revamp: Can Gautam Adani transform Asia's largest slum?How the Adani Group's Rs 2.5 lakh crore redevelopment and rehabilitation plan promises to play out for Dharavi's 1.2 million residents

Open office, closed minds? Why babus feel exposed in Kartavya BhavanPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Kartavya Bhavan-3, which will house several ministries of the Central government. However, top Central government officers have written to the PMO over the lack of private cabins in the building. They say the open-seating arrangement compromises confidentiality, affects efficiency and is demoralising.

Will Trump's tariff bombs see India, Russia, China gang-up on US?Trump India tariffs: August is already seeing hectic diplomatic activity as Trump drops tariff bombs on India. NSA Ajit Doval is in Russia, and Jaishankar will head there in a few days. Meanwhile, PM Modi will visit China later this month.

Tit for tat: Shashi Tharoor wants India to match Trump's 50% tariff hikeCongress MP Shashi Tharoor criticises US tariff hike on Indian exports citing unfair targeting. He urges Modi government to impose reciprocal duties and explore alternative trade markets.

How a saree hidden in Prajwal Revanna's farmhouse sealed his fate in rape caseA hidden saree helped convict former MP Prajwal Revanna for raping a 47-year-old domestic worker. The forensic evidence on it proved crucial to the case. He was sentenced to life imprisonment and fined Rs 11 lakh.

Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Over 90 countries affected by Trump's tariffs — See full list hereFrom allies to rivals, over 90 countries faced tariffs during Donald Trump's presidency. Here's a detailed look at which nations were impacted, how much duty was imposed, and what it meant for global trade dynamics.

Supreme Court rejects Justice Varma's plea in cash row, clears decks for removalJustice Yashwant Varma had challenged the in-house inquiry report that recommended his removal after a large cash stash was found in his residence earlier this year.

China-Pak military integration: What is CENTAIC and should India be concerned?CENTAIC, a China-backed AI and computing centre in Pakistan, aims to transform the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) into a network-centric force integrated with China's military systems. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi mentioned CENTAIC in his Op Sindoor speech. Here's more about CENTAIC and if it should be a concern for India.

Lifafas, laddoos and love: A nostalgic walk through rakhi celebrationsRakhi is more than just a thread; it's a symbol of memories, traditions, and emotions. This nostalgic piece reflects how we celebrated Raksha Bandhan in the '90s and how it still continues in 2025 in new ways, with the same love.
A nation without school teachers: Who will teach the next generation?From Delhi to Dubai, Boston to Brisbane, teachers are walking out, and classrooms are paying the price.

sports.headline: Joe Root will have nightmares about Josh Hazlewood before Ashes: David WarnerWith the Ashes set to take place in Australia later this year, David Warner has once again taken a dig at Joe Root, suggesting the England batter still struggles against Josh Hazlewood — and might already be thinking about it.

With Cooley leaving, BCCI starts hunt for new coaches at Centre of ExcellenceThe BCCI's Centre of Excellence is gearing up for a major overhaul of its coaching staff, with applications invited for key positions in the bowling, batting, and sports science and medicine departments.

Bumrah didn't perform like no 1 bowler in England, should've pushed harder: PathanFormer India all rounder Irfan Pathan has said that Jasprit Bumrah didn't perform like the number one bowler in England and should've pushed himself harder.

What is Continental Tour? World Athletics event being held in India for the first timeIndia will host the World Athletics Continental Tour Bronze event for the first time. Set to be hosted in Bhubaneshwar's Kalinga Stadium, several top Indian athletes will be in focus at the one-day event.

Tottenham's James Maddison sidelined from action after pre-season ACL tearJames Maddison will be out of action for most of the 2024-25 season after picking up an ACL injury during their pre-season game against Newcastle United.

England not in favour of two-tier World Test Championship and their reason is bizarreECB chairman Richard Thompson has raised concerns over the proposed two-tier Test cricket structure. He fears relegation could prevent England from regularly playing top teams like India and Australia, urging for better scheduling instead.

Jannik Sinner eyes Cincinnati title defence after much-needed recoveryWorld number one Jannik Sinner said he made the right decision by taking an extended break after his Wimbledon triumph, and the recharged Italian is now ready to defend his title at the Cincinnati Open.

The matter is being invesigated by a three-member panel on the Sports Ministry's instructions.

Konstas, McSweeney named in Australia A squad for India tour in SeptemberAustralia A has announced a 14-member men's squad for the upcoming tour of India in September. The selection focuses on developing young talent and spin options ahead of the 2027 Test series in India.

Gill doesn't need Jasprit Bumrah, India can win Tests without him: PanesarMonty Panesar praised Shubman Gill's leadership in first series as India's Test captain. He also applauded Mohammed Siraj and hailed him to be the key for India's bowling attack.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
